cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the Florida Keys Monday, then into the southeastern Gulf aiming toward the central Gulf Coast (AL–MS–eastern LA) by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast (near the MS/AL coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama-Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, Louisiana, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and South Florida Monday, then the central Gulf Coast from AL westward to southeast Louisiana Tuesday night–Wednesday
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may bring occasional gusts; probability of sustained tropical-storm-force winds is very low (~4%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the northeast Florida Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Brief squalls Monday could drop 1–2 inches of rain, mainly well south of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip currents and rough surf along Atlantic beaches Monday–Tuesday.
